abstract: Kentucky Energy and Environment Cabinet fines Frasure Creek Mining and its parent companies, Trinity Coal and New Trinity, $500,000 and bars companies from applying for mining permits in state indefinitely; move comes after coal mining company owns up to thousands of Clean Water Act violations, culmination of five-year battle by environmental coalition.
lead_paragraph: The state’s Energy and Environment Cabinet has agreed to fine a coal mining company that acknowledged thousands of violations, effectively barring the company from operating there.

headline.main: Kentucky: Coal Firm Fined and Barred From State
headline.print_headline: Kentucky: Coal Company Is Fined and Barred for Fouling Water

snippet: The state’s Energy and Environment Cabinet has agreed to fine a coal mining company that acknowledged thousands of violations, effectively barring the company from operating there.
